contentfulBlogPost.title: Podcast Collaborations with Blankets for T.O.

content.value: Learn more about the vision of Blankets for T.O. and the stories of its members by listening to podcasts on the go! This article will be kept up to date with the latest podcasts dealing with Blankets for T.O., as they are uploaded. Happy listening!
Listen to an interview of one of our co-presidents, Nimit Vediya, who appeared as a guest on

podcast with host Jonathan Collaton. Jonathan, from the Office of Student Experience and Wellbeing at University of Toronto Scarborough, engages in frequent interviews with students of UTSC to get a glimpse at the UTSC student experience and share knowledge.
The Meeting Place Podcast Episode 21 (Guest: Nimit Vediya)
to learn about how a tragic news event became a source of inspiration for Nimit and his soon-to-be co-presidents to start Blankets for T.O.
Co-hosts Nimit Vediya, Naman Sharma and Rushil Dave host

where the three talk about a wide variety of topics with a special guest. You'll hear about their university experiences and their outlook for the future of artificial intelligence. Most importantly, they discuss all things medicine-related, including how to get into medical school and beyond.
The MedBoys Podcast Episode 7: "What would YOU do if you saw someone in need?" with Blankets for T.O.
where our hosts discuss how Blankets for T.O. was formed, and the various challenges the organization faced in its initial stages.

node.title: MP Shaun Chenâ€™s Canada Day Weekend Giveaway

childMarkdownRemark.html: Members of the Blankets for T.O. team helped with MP Shaun Chen's giveaway event to Scarborough North residents to celebrate Canada Day 2021!

node.title: Care Packages complete, MP Shaun Chen honours Blankets for T.O.

childMarkdownRemark.html: During the Blankets for T.O. Care Package Event we gathered essential items to create personalized Care Package bags and donated them to local shelters. We also received a visit and a certificate from Member of Parliament Shaun Chen!

We collaborate with Water.org to provide students with opportunities to socialize with friends, win prizes in games and raffles, and become better informed about homelessness in Toronto and water scarcity around the world.
